snippet: The Nusra Front, the Syrian affiliate of Al Qaeda, said it disagreed with plans by Turkey and the United States to clear the Islamic State from an area along the Turkish border.
abstract: Syria's Al Qaeda-affiliate Nusra Front says it has withdrawn from northern Syria in response to Turkey's agreement with United States to sweep Turkish border clear of Islamic State militants; says plan does not help Syrian rebels' goals; US Defense Dept disputes statement, but activists in area say other rebel groups have taken up position vacated by Nusra Front in fight against Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: The Nusra Front, the Syrian affiliate of Al Qaeda, said it disagreed with plans by Turkey and the United States to clear the Islamic State from an area along the Turkish border.

headline.main: Nusra Front Announces Withdrawal From Front Line Against ISIS in Syria
headline.print_headline: Syrian Qaeda Branch Withdraws From Anti-ISIS Front Line

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
